sessionSampleRate.description: sample rate of Datadog RUM events

sessionReplaySampleRate.description: sample rate of session replays based upon already sampled Datadog RUM events

host.description: The host that the frontend should be bound to. Only used for local development.

port.description: The port that the frontend should be bound to. Only used for local development.

https.description: Only used for local development. The https object is passed to webpack in order to enable using https on localhost.

certificate.description: Parent object containing certificate and the private key

key.description: Https Certificate private key. Use $file to load in a file

cert.description: Https Certificate. Use $file to load in a file

enabled.description: Enable or disable the autologout feature

idleTimeoutMinutes.description:
Number of minutes after which the inactive user is logged out automatically.
Default is 60 minutes (1 hour)

promptBeforeIdleSeconds.description:
Number of seconds before the idle timeout where the user will be asked if it's still active.
A dialog will be shown.
Default is 10 seconds.
Set to 0 seconds to disable the prompt.

useWorkerTimers.description:
Enable/disable the usage of worker thread timers instead of main thread timers.
Default is true.
If you experience some browser incompatibility, you may try to set this to false.

logoutIfDisconnected.description:
Enable/disable the automatic logout also on users that are logged in but with no Backstage tabs open.
Default is true.

baseUrl.description: The public absolute root URL that the frontend.

title.description: The title of the app, as shown in the Backstage web interface.

support.description: Information about support of this Backstage instance and how to contact the integrator team.

items.description: A list of categorized support item groupings.

title.description: The title of the support item grouping.

icon.description: An optional icon for the support item grouping.

links.description: A list of support links for the Backstage instance inside this grouping.

bindings.description:
Maps external route references to regular route references. Both the
key and the value is expected to be on the form `<pluginId>.<routeId>`.
If the value is `false`, the route will be disabled even if it has a
default mapping.

baseUrl.description: The public absolute root URL that the backend is reachable at, from the browser's perspective.

organization.description: Configuration that provides information about the organization that the app is for.

name.description: The name of the organization that the app belongs to.

homepage.description: This config was used by the HomepageTimer but has been replaced  by the HeaderWorldClock in the home plugin
homepage.deprecated: in favor of the HeaderWorldClock which is found in the home plugin

auth.description: Configuration that provides information on available configured authentication providers.

environment.description:
The 'environment' attribute added as an optional parameter to have configurable environment value for `auth.providers`.
default value: 'development'
optional values: 'development' | 'production'

enableExperimentalRedirectFlow.description: Enable redirect authentication flow type, instead of a popup for authentication.

endpoints.description:
Endpoints

A list of target baseUrls and the associated plugins.

target.description:
The target baseUrl to use for the plugin

Can be either a string or an object with internal and external keys. (Internal is used for the backend, external for the frontend)
Targets with `{{pluginId}}` or `{{ pluginId }} in the url will be replaced with the pluginId.

plugins.description: Array of plugins which use the target baseUrl.

enabled.description: Enable or disable the autologout feature

idleTimeoutMinutes.description:
Number of minutes after which the inactive user is logged out automatically.
Default is 60 minutes (1 hour)

promptBeforeIdleSeconds.description:
Number of seconds before the idle timeout where the user will be asked if it's still active.
A dialog will be shown.
Default is 10 seconds.
Set to 0 seconds to disable the prompt.

useWorkerTimers.description:
Enable/disable the usage of worker thread timers instead of main thread timers.
Default is true.
If you experience some browser incompatibility, you may try to set this to false.

logoutIfDisconnected.description:
Enable/disable the automatic logout also on users that are logged in but with no Backstage tabs open.
Default is true.

permission.description: Configuration options for Backstage permissions and authorization

enabled.description:
Whether authorization is enabled in Backstage. Defaults to false, which means authorization
requests will be automatically allowed without invoking the authorization policy.

integrations.description: Configuration for integrations towards various external repository provider systems

host.description: The hostname of the given Azure instance

credential.description:
The credential to use for requests.

If no credential is specified anonymous access is used.

credentials.description:
The credentials to use for requests. If multiple credentials are specified the first one that matches the organization is used.
If no organization matches the first credential without an organization is used.

If no credentials are specified at all, either a default credential (for Azure DevOps) or anonymous access (for Azure DevOps Server) is used.

commitSigningKey.description: PGP signing key for signing commits.

azureBlobStorage.description: Integration configuration for Azure Blob Storage

accountName.description: The name of the Azure Storage Account, e.g., "mystorageaccount".

accountKey.description:
The primary or secondary key for the Azure Storage Account.
Only required if connectionString or SAS token are not specified.

sasToken.description: A Shared Access Signature (SAS) token for limited access to resources.

connectionString.description:
A full connection string for the Azure Storage Account.
This includes the account name, key, and endpoint details.

endpointSuffix.description:
Optional endpoint suffix for custom domains or sovereign clouds.
e.g., "core.windows.net" for public Azure or "core.usgovcloudapi.net" for US Government cloud.

endpoint.description: Optional endpoint URL for custom domain. Uses default if not provided.

aadCredential.description: Optional credential to use for Azure Active Directory authentication.

clientId.description: The client ID of the Azure AD application.

tenantId.description: The tenant ID for Azure AD.

clientSecret.description: The client secret for the Azure AD application.

host.description: The hostname of the given Bitbucket instance

apiBaseUrl.description: The base url for the Bitbucket API, for example https://api.bitbucket.org/2.0

username.description: The username to use for authenticated requests.

appPassword.description: Bitbucket app password used to authenticate requests.

commitSigningKey.description: PGP signing key for signing commits.

username.description: The username to use for authenticated requests.

appPassword.description: Bitbucket Cloud app password used to authenticate requests.

clientId.description: OAuth client ID for Bitbucket Cloud.

clientSecret.description: OAuth client secret for Bitbucket Cloud.

commitSigningKey.description: PGP signing key for signing commits.

host.description: The hostname of the given Bitbucket Server instance

username.description: Username used to authenticate requests with Basic Auth.

password.description: Password (or token as password) used to authenticate requests with Basic Auth.

apiBaseUrl.description: The base url for the Bitbucket Server API, for example https://<host>/rest/api/1.0

commitSigningKey.description: PGP signing key for signing commits.

host.description: The hostname of the given Gerrit instance

baseUrl.description: The base url for the Gerrit instance.

cloneUrl.description: The base url for cloning repos.

username.description: The username to use for authenticated requests.

password.description:
Gerrit password used to authenticate requests. This can be either a password
or a generated access token.

commitSigningKey.description: PGP signing key for signing commits.

host.description: The hostname of the given GitHub instance

apiBaseUrl.description: The base url for the GitHub API, for example https://api.github.com

rawBaseUrl.description: The base url for GitHub raw resources, for example https://raw.githubusercontent.com

appId.description: The numeric GitHub App ID, string for environment variables

privateKey.description: The private key to use for auth against the app

allowedInstallationOwners.description:
List of installation owners allowed to be used by this GitHub app. The GitHub UI does not provide a way to list the installations.
However you can list the installations with the GitHub API. You can find the list of installations here:
https://api.github.com/app/installations
The relevant documentation for this is here.
https://docs.github.com/en/rest/reference/apps#list-installations-for-the-authenticated-app--code-samples

publicAccess.description: If true, then an installation token will be issued for access when no other token is available.

host.description: The host of the target that this matches on, e.g. "gitlab.com".

apiBaseUrl.description:
The base URL of the API of this provider, e.g.
"https://gitlab.com/api/v4", with no trailing slash.

May be omitted specifically for public GitLab; then it will be deduced.

token.description:
The authorization token to use for requests to this provider.

If no token is specified, anonymous access is used.

baseUrl.description:
The baseUrl of this provider, e.g. "https://gitlab.com", which is
passed into the GitLab client.

If no baseUrl is provided, it will default to https://${host}.

commitSigningKey.description: PGP signing key for signing commits.

googleGcs.description: Integration configuration for Google Cloud Storage

clientEmail.description: Service account email used to authenticate requests.

privateKey.description: Service account private key used to authenticate requests.

awsS3.description: Integration configuration for AWS S3 Service

endpoint.description:
AWS Endpoint.
The endpoint URI to send requests to. The default endpoint is built from the configured region.

s3ForcePathStyle.description:
Whether to use path style URLs when communicating with S3.
Defaults to false.
This allows providers like LocalStack, Minio and Wasabi (and possibly others) to be used.

accessKeyId.description: Account access key used to authenticate requests.

secretAccessKey.description: Account secret key used to authenticate requests.

roleArn.description: ARN of the role to be assumed

externalId.description: External ID to use when assuming role

host.description: The hostname of the given Gitea instance

baseUrl.description: The base url for the Gitea instance.

username.description: The username to use for authenticated requests.

password.description:
Gitea password used to authenticate requests. This can be either a password
or a generated access token.

commitSigningKey.description: PGP signing key for signing commits.

host.description: The hostname of the given Harness Code instance

apiKey.description: The apikey to use for authenticated requests.

token.description: Harness Code token used to authenticate requests. This can be either a generated access token.

packages.deprecated: This is no longer experimental; use `app.packages` instead.

packages.description: Controls what packages are loaded by the new frontend system.

bindings.description:
Maps external route references to regular route references. Both the
key and the value is expected to be on the form `<pluginId>.<routeId>`.
If the value is `false`, the route will be disabled even if it has a
default mapping.

pluginOverrides.description:
This section enables you to override certain properties of specific or
groups of plugins.

match.description: The criteria for matching plugins to override.

pluginId.description: A pattern that is matched against the plugin ID.

packageName.description: A pattern that is matched against the package name.

info.description: Overrides individual top-level fields of the plugin info.

description.description: Override the description of the plugin.

ownerEntityRefs.description: Override the owner entity references of the plugin.

links.description: Override the links of the plugin.
